briefTitle: Self-Administered Lidocaine Gel for Pain Management With IUD Insertion

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Elective IUD insertion (any type of IUD, copper or hormonal); at an out-patient setting at Stanford; English or Spanish speaking, and ability to give informed consent.

Exclusion Criteria:

Any pre-operative use of misoprostol; or use of PO pain control medication (i.e. ibuprofen or acetaminophen) prior to procedure. Allergy to study medications: lidocaine, or surgical lubricant jelly, known uterine anomaly; prior cervical surgery; and no prior use of tampons.

outcomeMeasures.title: (IUD Insertion): Pain Perceived by Visual Analogue Scale (0-100 mm) Immediately Following Procedure Completion
outcomeMeasures.description: Pain immediately after speculum removal as measured by a Visual Analog Scale (VAS). This scale is 0-100--on the scale "0" had "no pain" and "100" had "worst pain imaginable" as anchors. A higher score indicates higher pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Anticipated Pain as Measured by a Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Pain as measured by a Visual Analog Scale (VAS). This scale is 0-100--on the scale "0" had "no pain" and "100" had "worst pain imaginable" as anchors. A higher score indicates higher pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Baseline Pain as Measured by a Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Pain as measured by a Visual Analog Scale (VAS). This scale is 0-100--on the scale "0" had "no pain" and "100" had "worst pain imaginable" as anchors. A higher score indicates higher pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain After Speculum Placement as Measured by a Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Pain as measured by a Visual Analog Scale (VAS). This scale is 0-100--on the scale "0" had "no pain" and "100" had "worst pain imaginable" as anchors. A higher score indicates higher pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain After Tenaculum Placement as Measured by a Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Pain as measured by a Visual Analog Scale (VAS). This scale is 0-100--on the scale "0" had "no pain" and "100" had "worst pain imaginable" as anchors. A higher score indicates higher pain.
